1.rationale:
Let's think this through. I'm currently at position (8, 2) and I see four apples on the board. My goal is to get as many points as possible.

First, I'll take a look at the apples. I see one at (9, 1), one at (7, 1), one at (9, 8), one at (4, 8), and one at (5, 6). I'll try to get as close to the apples as possible without running into the enemy snake or the wall.

I'll also take a look at the enemy snake's position. It's at (1, 2), which is relatively far from me. I don't see any immediate threats from it.

My strategy for this turn is to try to get closer to the apples while avoiding the enemy snake and the wall. I'll move in a direction that will allow me to get closer to the apples while also keeping an eye out for any potential threats.

After considering my options, I've decided to move... RIGHT.

However, I should also consider the long-term strategy. Since there are apples at (9, 8) and (4, 8), it might be beneficial to move towards the upper part of the board to reach those apples in the future.

Given these considerations, I will move towards the apple at (5, 6) for now, but I will keep an eye on the upper part of the board for future moves.
